perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, EZJR currently owns a Customer Relationship Management (“CRM”) software program as developed by LEADER; and

WHEREAS, upon the purchase of the software EZJR entered into an agreement for LEADER to maintain the software for a period of two
years after which LEADER was be paid by EZJR to service and maintain the software; and
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, EZJR currently possesses a Client Management System (“CMS”) software program as developed by LEADER; and

WHEREAS, upon the purchase of the software EZJR entered into an agreement for LEADER to maintain the software for a period of two
years after which LEADER will be provided consideration by EZJR to service and sustain the software; and
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Customer Relationship Management (“CRM”) software program' to 'Client Management System (“CMS”) software program' introduces ambiguity. Are CRM and CMS the same thing? Also, Changing 'paid' to 'provided consideration' introduces uncertainty about the form payment.

perturbation.original_text:
1. EXTENSION OF SERVICE AGREEMENT. Subject to all other terms and conditions set forth herein, as of the date of this agreement, LEADER
maintain the software for an additional five years.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. EXTENSION OF SERVICE AGREEMENT. Subject to all other terms and conditions set forth herein, as of the date of this agreement, LEADER
provide support for the application for an additional five years.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'maintain the software' to 'provide support for the application' creates confusion. Is 'support' the same as 'maintenance'? What level of service is expected? Does support include updates, bug fixes, or only basic troubleshooting? The term 'application' could also be interpreted differently than 'software'.

perturbation.original_text:
Exhibit A

Customer Relationship Management System Description

The Customer Relationship Management (“CRM”) system entails all aspects of interaction that a company has with its customer, whether it is sales
or service-related. It also provides a greater understanding of the customer and helps manage customer data and all interaction with the customer.
perturbation.changed_text:
Exhibit A

Customer Relationship Management System Description

The Customer Relationship Management (“CRM”) platform encompasses some aspects of interaction that a company has with its customer, primarily sales
or service-related. It also provides tools for understanding some customer attributes and helps organize limited customer data and certain interactions with the customer.
perturbation.explanation: Changing system to platform, all to some, greater understanding to tools for understanding some customer attributes, manage to organize limited customer data, and all interaction to certain interactions introduces ambiguity about the CRM's function. The revised definitions limit the scope and capability of the system, undermining the original agreement.
